abstract.p: Royal Bank of Canada and TD Bank Financial Group, Canada's two largest banks, report record second-quarter profits; Royal Bank posts 30 percent increase in profit to 562 million Canadian dollars, or $393 million; TD Bank earned 537 million Canadian dollars, or $376 million, 50 percent increase in profits; TD's chief executive Charles Baillie comments; photo (S)

block.p: Canada's two largest banks -- Royal Bank of Canada and the TD Bank Financial Group, both based in Toronto -- reported record second-quarter profits. Royal Bank posted a 30 percent increase in profit to 562 million Canadian dollars, or $393 million. TD Bank, which fattened its asset base by 30 percent with the purchase of Canada Trust last year, earned 537 million Canadian dollars, or $376 million, reported profits were up 50 percent. TD's chief executive, Charles Baillie, called the results ''a defining quarter,'' because of the strong earnings and inclusion of Canada Trust.

Canada's two largest banks -- Royal Bank of Canada and the TD Bank Financial Group, both based in Toronto -- reported record second-quarter profits. Royal Bank posted a 30 percent increase in profit to 562 million Canadian dollars, or $393 million. TD Bank, which fattened its asset base by 30 percent with the purchase of Canada Trust last year, earned 537 million Canadian dollars, or $376 million, reported profits were up 50 percent. TD's chief executive, Charles Baillie, called the results ''a defining quarter,'' because of the strong earnings and inclusion of Canada Trust.
